manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 2Megapixel 1080P HD USB board camera that is Linux,Android,Windows& Mac compatible. Parameters: Model: ELP-USBFHD01M-L21(2.1mm lens) Sensor:1/3" CMOS OV2710 Max Resolution:2.0megapixel, 1920(H)x1080(V)pixels Support free driver: USB Video Class(UVC)1.1 Auto exposure AEC: Support Auto white blance Frame rate : MJPEG 30fps@1920(H) x1080(V) MJPEG 60fps@1280(H) x 720(V) MJPEG 100fps@ 640(H) x 480(V) Adjustable parameters: Brightness/Contrast/Color saturation /Definition/Gamma/WB Support OS:"WinXP/Vista/WIN7/WIN8/Linux with UVC Mac-OS X 10.4.8 or later/Wince with UVC/Android 4.0 or above"

Fast frame for high speed moving, 30fps@1080p, 60fps@720p, 100fps@VGA. Performance: 1920 (H) x 1080 (V) pixels MJPEG 30fps YUY2 6fps 1280 (H) x 1024 (V) pixels MJPEG 30fps YUY2 6fps 1280 (H) x 720 (V) pixels MJPEG 60fps YUY2 9fps 1024 (H) x 768 (V) pixels MJPEG 30fps YUY2 9fps 800 (H) x 600 (V) pixels MJPEG 60fps YUY2 21fps 640 (H) x 480 (V) pixels MJPEG 100fps YUY2 30fps
The HD 1080P USB CMOS board camera module is ideal for many applications such as: security systems, portable video system, video phones, industrial machine monitoring and toys.

Adopt 2Megapixel HD 2.1mm Lens. The lens is wide angle around 80~120+ degree. The picture is pretty sharp full HD 1920X1080P 1Meter(approximately 40 inches) long cable with a small 4 pin connector that plugs into the camera board.

Support computer,laptop,pc,Android development board,Raspberry Pi development board,Jetson Nano,etc Small outline and thin profile for embedded machine vision For PC: Support windows,linux,mac,Android,raspberry PiVery easy to use,UVC compliant,free driver,just plug in and go. For Pi: Support Android development board,Raspberry Pi development board,Jetson Nano,etc.

High speed usb camera module for computer 100fps wide angle mini embedded webcam board for quick moving objects shooting. About ELP USB Camera Module: Definition: ELP usb camera module is a small camera device that connects to a computer or device via a USB interface. These modules typically includ a camera sensor,a lens,and other necessary components to capture image or video.ELP usb camera module can be used in a wide range of applications,including video conference,security and surveillance,machine vision,and robotics.They are often used in conjuction with computer vision software to perform tasks such as object recognition,tracking,analysis.ELP usb camera module are available in various sizes and configurations,ranging from small modules that can fit on a circuit board to larger module with built-in enclosures.They can also be designed for different environtal conditions,such as low-light or outdoor use.Overall,ELP usb camera module are a versatile and convenient way yo add imaging capabilities to a wide range of devices and applications. Used for all kinds of machine as below: machinery equipment, all-in-one machine, POS equipment, STB, smart box TV BOX, advisement playerLED display, automatic vending machine, safety box, notebook, video door phone, MID, Tablet externalevaluator, Medical Equipment, on-the-spot law enforcement, door bell and button system, cat-eye systemsimple security system, teaching system, Interactive system, automobile data recorder.Project video capture, credit card machine, attendance machine, Voting system, High speed video shooting Deviceexam system, Driving learning system, Industrial camera, biological microscope, box inside surveillancemicro HD surveillance, endoscope, Medical auxiliary equipment, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Cam For Electronic Hobyists with Raspberry Pi
reviews.reviewText: I thought that this was a great camera to use for raspberry pi projects. I created a motion sensing camera with this that when someone walks by it will snap a picture of them. This camera works great for taking pictures. I was also impressed with the picture quality that it gives.I would say that one draw back of it would have to be that you need external light since it does not do very well in low lit applications.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It has surprisingly great image quality in well lit scenarios. I'm satisfied with the quality.
reviews.reviewText: Great image quality for the money. If you need excellent quality go for the pricier Logitech cams. Low light test wasn't as good as can be. The USB cable attached feels stronger than the really cheap rivals I have used before. Another feature I loved is the fact that I can play with the focus by adjusting the lens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2015
reviews.reviewText: Good quality but mjpeg colorspace does not work with some codecs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Lens is glued in!
reviews.reviewText: Got this for a computer vision project and when it arrived I learned that they glued the lens in making the camera completely useless for my project (I need to be able to adjust the focal length).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for Raspberry Pi 2 and Octoprint for 3d printer monitoring!
reviews.reviewText: Pretty Amazing USB camera! the lens angle is aroudn 120+ deg and there is a fair ammout of "fisheye" effect including dark spots where the lens rim is in the corners of the shot.Lens is crystal clear! And the camera focus is nice and sharp. Also worth noting, the camera appears to do native MPEG strearming, so if you use it to "web cam" images off something small like a raspberrypi, the machine doesnt have to work as hard transcoding the image stream!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Super cheap camera and poor quality, will not buy again.
reviews.reviewText: Due to COVID-19, web cams are priced 3X their normal price and my application for a camera is OctoPi so I can keep an eye on my 3D printer, I don't need sound. So I opted for this camera. Horrible quality. Also, OctoPi isn't able to reduce the frame rate and I had to add `additional_brokenfps_usb_devices=("32e4:9230")` to `/boot/octopi.txt` in order to get it to work at all. The picture has green, horizontal lines that flash in and out at random places. Ugh.This rating form asks me to score its "Sheerness". Not sure what that is, so, average, I guess. The circuit board is pretty thin though, so, I guess 4 stars for "Thickness", lol.On the plus side, I tested it on Mac and on Linux and in both cases, no additional drivers were required. The fisheye lens adds a lot of distortion, but in my case, it allows me to see nearly the whole print bed, so, that's a plus.I literally would not use this camera for any other application and, TBH, once the pandemic passes and WebCam prices return to something resembling sanity, I'll likely replace this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I just tried on a different Linux computer with more up-to-date packages (Arch) and it worked much better. I haven't tracked dow
reviews.reviewText: When I first plugged this in and tested on Linux, I was getting really lousy frame rates using cheese (Linux Mint 15). I just tried on a different Linux computer with more up-to-date packages (Arch) and it worked much better. I haven't tracked down which V4L2 parameters to use for the improved behavior yet.The camera handles low light better than most other webcams I've tried. The picture is pretty sharp, but the colors seem less vibrant than most webcams. Maybe the typical webcam is software correcting for that, and this is just truer to the real sensor output? There is a lot of fish eye effect, and moving the camera seems to cause more distortion than you'd get on a high-end webcam. (but it's way better than a low-end webcam)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Excellent little camera that works as advertised. I bought a pair for a stereo vision application and they seem well suited for my needs plus reasonable price.
The lens gives a usefully wide field of view, and can be swapped for other M12 lenses if needed. Image quality is good. Works out of the box with supported resolutions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 26, 2016
reviews.reviewText: It does what it says on the box without fuss.* MPEG offers reasonable image quality but for the best quality (although at a much lower framrate) use YUY2 instead.* Comes with a 1M USB lead.* Lens mounting thread is fairly standard and you can easily source ones with different focal lengths.Notes:* As with all cameras of this type, beware of getting dust/contamination on the sensor whern changing the lens.* You may need to tighten up the two screws holding the lens bracket to the PCB. I have a few of these cameras, and on some the screws were loose making getting a reliable focus difficult until I realised what the problem was.* The latest hardware does not match the image shown with the lens mounting being slightly longer and does not have a lens locking screw. The lens is 'fixed' in position by a waxy material that resists movement in the screw but still allows the focus to be changed.That means that if you need to change the lens (as I do) then you will need to source some more of the 'wax' or devise some other means of securing the lens in position.
